backDesc: I am a teacher. / I was at the store yesterday. / I have been at that store many times.
frontDesc: Jeg er lærer. / Jeg var i butikken i går. / Jeg har vært i den butikken mange ganger.

backDesc: I want to become a doctor. / I became tired. / I have become more determined.
frontDesc: Jeg vil bli lege. / Jeg ble sliten. / Jeg har blitt mer bestemt.

backDesc: I begin a new project. / I began reading a book. / I have begun working on it seriously.
frontDesc: Jeg begynner et nytt prosjekt. / Jeg begynte å lese en bok. / Jeg har begynt å jobbe seriøst med det.

backDesc: I don't want to break the rules. / He broke the branch. / He has broken many rules in the past.
frontDesc: Jeg vil ikke bryte reglene. / Han brakk grenen. / Han har brutt mange regler før.

backDesc: I bring coffee. / She brought flowers. / She has brought gifts as well.
frontDesc: Jeg tar med kaffe. / Hun tok med blomster. / Hun har også tatt med gaver.

backDesc: I build a house. / He built a bridge. / He has built many bridges in his career.
frontDesc: Jeg bygger et hus. / Han bygde en bro. / Han har bygd mange broer i karrieren.

backDesc: I buy new clothes. / She bought a car. / She has bought several cars over the years.
frontDesc: Jeg kjøper nye klær. / Hun kjøpte en bil. / Hun har kjøpt flere biler gjennom årene.

backDesc: I can help. / He could come earlier. / He has been able to assist many times.
frontDesc: Jeg kan hjelpe. / Han kunne komme tidligere. / Han har kunnet hjelpe mange ganger.

backDesc: I catch the ball. / He caught a fish. / He has caught many fish in this lake.
frontDesc: Jeg fanger ballen. / Han fanget en fisk. / Han har fanget mange fisk i denne innsjøen.

backDesc: I choose a dish. / She chose a book. / She has chosen wisely every time.
frontDesc: Jeg velger en rett. / Hun valgte en bok. / Hun har valgt klokt hver gang.

backDesc: I come to work. / He came earlier. / He has come on time every day.
frontDesc: Jeg kommer på jobb. / Han kom tidligere. / Han har kommet presis hver dag.

backDesc: It costs five dollars. / It cost more yesterday. / It has cost me a fortune so far.
frontDesc: Den koster fem dollar. / Den kostet mer i går. / Den har kostet meg en formue så langt.

backDesc: I cut the paper. / He cut the wood. / He has cut many pieces of wood before.
frontDesc: Jeg klipper papiret. / Han kuttet veden. / Han har kuttet mange trebiter før.

backDesc: I cast away the old clothes. / He cast the net. / He has cast a net before to catch fish.
frontDesc: Jeg kaster bort de gamle klærne. / Han kastet garnet. / Han har kastet garn tidligere for å fange fisk.

backDesc: I do my homework. / He did the dinner. / He has done this type of work before.
frontDesc: Jeg gjør leksene mine. / Han sto for middagen. / Han har gjort denne typen arbeid før.

backDesc: I draw a picture. / She drew a landscape. / She has drawn many landscapes.
frontDesc: Jeg tegner et bilde. / Hun tegnet et landskap. / Hun har tegnet mange landskap.

backDesc: I drink water. / He drank juice. / He has drunk all the juice in the fridge.
frontDesc: Jeg drikker vann. / Han drakk jus. / Han har drukket all jusen i kjøleskapet.

backDesc: I drive a car. / She drove the bus. / She has driven that route many times.
frontDesc: Jeg kjører bil. / Hun kjørte bussen. / Hun har kjørt den ruten mange ganger.

backDesc: I dwell in Warsaw. / He dwelt there earlier. / He has dwelt in many cities over the years.
frontDesc: Jeg bor i Warszawa. / Han bodde der tidligere. / Han har bodd i mange byer gjennom årene.

backDesc: I eat breakfast. / She ate lunch. / She has eaten at this restaurant before.
frontDesc: Jeg spiser frokost. / Hun spiste lunsj. / Hun har spist på denne restauranten før.

backDesc: I fall off the bike. / He fell from the ladder. / He has fallen a few times lately.
frontDesc: Jeg faller av sykkelen. / Han falt fra stigen. / Han har falt noen ganger i det siste.

backDesc: I feel good. / She felt pain. / She has felt better since then.
frontDesc: Jeg føler meg bra. / Hun følte smerte. / Hun har følt seg bedre siden da.

backDesc: I fight for my rights. / He fought in the war. / He has fought bravely for his country.
frontDesc: Jeg kjemper for rettighetene mine. / Han kjempet i krigen. / Han har kjempet tappert for landet sitt.

backDesc: I find the key. / She found the solution. / She has found many solutions so far.
frontDesc: Jeg finner nøkkelen. / Hun fant løsningen. / Hun har funnet mange løsninger så langt.

backDesc: I fly by airplane. / He flew to London. / He has flown internationally many times.
frontDesc: Jeg flyr med fly. / Han fløy til London. / Han har fløyet internasjonalt mange ganger.

backDesc: I forget the name. / She forgot the keys. / She has forgotten them before.
frontDesc: Jeg glemmer navnet. / Hun glemte nøklene. / Hun har glemt dem før.

backDesc: I get a letter. / He got a gift. / He has gotten many gifts recently.
frontDesc: Jeg får et brev. / Han fikk en gave. / Han har fått mange gaver i det siste.

backDesc: I give you a gift. / She gave him a book. / She has given many books as presents.
frontDesc: Jeg gir deg en gave. / Hun ga ham en bok. / Hun har gitt mange bøker som gaver.

backDesc: I go to school. / He went to work. / He has gone there every day this week.
frontDesc: Jeg går på skolen. / Han dro på jobb. / Han har dratt dit hver dag denne uken.

backDesc: I grind coffee. / He ground the grain. / He has ground coffee beans for years.
frontDesc: Jeg maler kaffe. / Han malte kornet. / Han har malt kaffebønner i årevis.

backDesc: I grow every day. / He grew quickly. / He has grown a lot this year.
frontDesc: Jeg vokser hver dag. / Han vokste raskt. / Han har vokst mye i år.

backDesc: I have a car. / He had a guitar. / She has had many opportunities to travel.
frontDesc: Jeg har en bil. / Han hadde en gitar. / Hun har hatt mange muligheter til å reise.

backDesc: I hear music. / He heard the noise. / He has heard that noise before.
frontDesc: Jeg hører musikk. / Han hørte lyden. / Han har hørt den lyden før.

backDesc: I hide the gift. / She hid the letter. / She has hidden messages in her diary.
frontDesc: Jeg gjemmer gaven. / Hun gjemte brevet. / Hun har gjemt meldinger i dagboken sin.

backDesc: I hit the ball. / He hit the door. / He has hit that ball many times.
frontDesc: Jeg slår ballen. / Han slo døren. / Han har slått den ballen mange ganger.

backDesc: I hold the book. / She held the bag. / She has held onto that bag for years.
frontDesc: Jeg holder boken. / Hun holdt vesken. / Hun har holdt på den vesken i årevis.

backDesc: I hurt myself while running. / He hurt his hand. / He has hurt himself multiple times.
frontDesc: Jeg skader meg mens jeg løper. / Han skadet hånden sin. / Han har skadet seg flere ganger.

backDesc: I keep a secret. / She kept the documents. / She has kept them in a safe place.
frontDesc: Jeg beholder en hemmelighet. / Hun beholdt dokumentene. / Hun har oppbevart dem på et trygt sted.

backDesc: I know the answer. / He knew the solution. / He has known it all along.
frontDesc: Jeg vet svaret. / Han visste løsningen. / Han har visst det hele tiden.

backDesc: I learn English. / She learned to dance. / She has learned many languages.
frontDesc: Jeg lærer engelsk. / Hun lærte å danse. / Hun har lært mange språk.

backDesc: I leave the house. / He left the office. / He has left his job recently.
frontDesc: Jeg forlater huset. / Han forlot kontoret. / Han har forlatt jobben sin nylig.

backDesc: I lend a book. / She lent money. / She has lent money to friends before.
frontDesc: Jeg låner bort en bok. / Hun lånte penger. / Hun har lånt bort penger til venner før.

backDesc: I let you in. / He let her stay. / He has let many people stay at his place.
frontDesc: Jeg lar deg komme inn. / Han lot henne bli. / Han har latt mange folk bo hos seg.

backDesc: I lie on the couch. / He lay on the bed. / He has lain there for hours.
frontDesc: Jeg ligger på sofaen. / Han lå i senga. / Han har ligget der i timevis.

backDesc: I lose my keys. / He lost his wallet. / He has lost things many times.
frontDesc: Jeg mister nøklene mine. / Han mistet lommeboka. / Han har mistet ting mange ganger.

backDesc: I make dinner. / She made a cake. / She has made many delicious cakes.
frontDesc: Jeg lager middag. / Hun lagde en kake. / Hun har laget mange deilige kaker.

backDesc: It means something important. / He meant something else. / He has meant it sincerely all along.
frontDesc: Det betyr noe viktig. / Han mente noe annet. / Han har ment det oppriktig hele veien.

backDesc: I meet with friends. / She met with the manager. / She has met many interesting people.
frontDesc: Jeg møter venner. / Hun møtte sjefen. / Hun har møtt mange interessante mennesker.

backDesc: I pay the bills. / He paid for dinner. / He has paid his dues already.
frontDesc: Jeg betaler regningene. / Han betalte for middagen. / Han har allerede betalt det han skylder.

backDesc: I put the book on the table. / She put the keys on the shelf. / She has put them there before.
frontDesc: Jeg legger boken på bordet. / Hun la nøklene på hyllen. / Hun har lagt dem der før.

backDesc: I read the newspaper. / He read the book. / He has read that book many times.
frontDesc: Jeg leser avisen. / Han leste boken. / Han har lest den boken mange ganger.

backDesc: I ride a bike. / She rode a horse. / She has ridden many horses in her life.
frontDesc: Jeg sykler. / Hun red på en hest. / Hun har ridd mange hester i sitt liv.

backDesc: I ring you. / He rang me. / He has rung me every day this week.
frontDesc: Jeg ringer deg. / Han ringte meg. / Han har ringt meg hver dag denne uken.

backDesc: The sun rises in the morning. / He rose his hand. / He has risen early every day.
frontDesc: Solen står opp om morgenen. / Han løftet hånden sin. / Han har stått opp tidlig hver dag.

backDesc: I run every day. / He ran faster. / He has run marathons before.
frontDesc: Jeg løper hver dag. / Han løp raskere. / Han har løpt maraton før.

backDesc: I say the truth. / He said something important. / He has said that many times.
frontDesc: Jeg sier sannheten. / Han sa noe viktig. / Han har sagt det mange ganger.

backDesc: I see the stars. / She saw a bird. / She has seen many birds lately.
frontDesc: Jeg ser stjernene. / Hun så en fugl. / Hun har sett mange fugler i det siste.

backDesc: I sell a car. / He sold the house. / He has sold several houses this year.
frontDesc: Jeg selger en bil. / Han solgte huset. / Han har solgt flere hus i år.

backDesc: I send a letter. / She sent a package. / She has sent many packages abroad.
frontDesc: Jeg sender et brev. / Hun sendte en pakke. / Hun har sendt mange pakker til utlandet.

backDesc: I set the alarm for 7 AM. / He set the tables for the party. / He has set them up perfectly.
frontDesc: Jeg stiller vekkerklokken til klokka 7. / Han dekket bordene til festen. / Han har dekket dem perfekt.

backDesc: I shake my hands when I'm nervous. / He shook his hand in farewell. / He has shaken hands many times.
frontDesc: Jeg rister på hendene når jeg er nervøs. / Han tok ham i hånden til farvel. / Han har håndhilst mange ganger.

backDesc: The sun shines brightly today. / He shone the lighthouse at night. / He has shone it on the rocks before.
frontDesc: Solen skinner sterkt i dag. / Han lyste med fyret om natten. / Han har lyst mot klippene før.

backDesc: I shoot with a bow during practice. / He shot a goal in the game. / He has shot many goals this season.
frontDesc: Jeg skyter med bue under trening. / Han skjøt et mål i kampen. / Han har skutt mange mål denne sesongen.

backDesc: I show photos from vacation. / He showed his new car. / He has shown it to everyone.
frontDesc: Jeg viser bilder fra ferien. / Han viste fram den nye bilen sin. / Han har vist den til alle.

backDesc: I shut the door before leaving. / He shut the window when it got cold. / He has shut them every night.
frontDesc: Jeg lukker døren før jeg drar. / Han lukket vinduet da det ble kaldt. / Han har lukket dem hver kveld.

backDesc: I sing my favorite song. / She sang at the concert. / She has sung there many times.
frontDesc: Jeg synger min favorittsang. / Hun sang på konserten. / Hun har sunget der mange ganger.

backDesc: The ship sinks in the sea. / He sank during the storm. / It has sunk completely.
frontDesc: Skipet synker i havet. / Han sank under stormen. / Det har sunket fullstendig.

backDesc: I sit on the chair. / She sat at the table. / She has sat there for hours.
frontDesc: Jeg sitter på stolen. / Hun satt ved bordet. / Hun har sittet der i timevis.

backDesc: I sleep in my bed. / He slept all night. / He has slept well lately.
frontDesc: Jeg sover i sengen min. / Han sov hele natten. / Han har sovet godt i det siste.

backDesc: I speak English. / He spoke at the conference. / He has spoken there twice.
frontDesc: Jeg snakker engelsk. / Han snakket på konferansen. / Han har snakket der to ganger.

backDesc: I spend time with my family. / He spent a lot of money on the trip. / He has spent all his savings.
frontDesc: Jeg tilbringer tid med familien min. / Han brukte mye penger på turen. / Han har brukt opp alle sparepengene sine.

backDesc: I stand at the head of the team. / She stood by the window. / She has stood there quietly.
frontDesc: Jeg står i spissen for teamet. / Hun sto ved vinduet. / Hun har stått der stille.

backDesc: I swim every morning. / He swam in the lake. / He has swum across that lake before.
frontDesc: Jeg svømmer hver morgen. / Han svømte i innsjøen. / Han har svømt over den innsjøen før.

backDesc: I take my medicine in the morning. / She took an umbrella. / She has taken it with her today.
frontDesc: Jeg tar medisinen min om morgenen. / Hun tok en paraply. / Hun har tatt den med seg i dag.

backDesc: I teach mathematics. / He taught me a new skill. / He has taught many students over the years.
frontDesc: Jeg underviser i matematikk. / Han lærte meg en ny ferdighet. / Han har undervist mange studenter gjennom årene.

backDesc: I always tell him about the change of plans. / She told me a secret. / She has told many secrets over time.
frontDesc: Jeg forteller ham alltid om planendringen. / Hun fortalte meg en hemmelighet. / Hun har fortalt mange hemmeligheter over tid.

backDesc: I think about the future. / He thought about solving the problem. / He has thought it through carefully.
frontDesc: Jeg tenker på fremtiden. / Han tenkte på å løse problemet. / Han har tenkt grundig gjennom det.

backDesc: I throw the ball into the basket. / She threw the bag on the ground. / She has thrown it away now.
frontDesc: Jeg kaster ballen i kurven. / Hun kastet vesken på bakken. / Hun har kastet den bort nå.

backDesc: I understand this task. / He understood my explanation. / He has understood everything clearly.
frontDesc: Jeg forstår denne oppgaven. / Han forsto forklaringen min. / Han har forstått alt tydelig.

backDesc: I always wake up early in the morning. / She woke up late. / She has woken up earlier on other days.
frontDesc: Jeg våkner alltid tidlig om morgenen. / Hun våknet sent. / Hun har våknet tidligere andre dager.

backDesc: I wear a new jacket. / He wore elegant clothes. / He has worn them many times before.
frontDesc: Jeg har på meg en ny jakke. / Han hadde på seg elegante klær. / Han har brukt dem mange ganger før.

backDesc: I win the board game. / She won the contest. / She has won many contests in her life.
frontDesc: Jeg vinner brettspillet. / Hun vant konkurransen. / Hun har vunnet mange konkurranser i sitt liv.

backDesc: I write a letter to a friend. / He wrote an article. / He has written several articles this month.
frontDesc: Jeg skriver et brev til en venn. / Han skrev en artikkel. / Han har skrevet flere artikler denne måneden.

backDesc: Problems arise suddenly. / He arose from the problems. / He has arisen to face new challenges.
frontDesc: Problemer oppstår plutselig. / Han reiste seg fra problemene. / Han har stått opp for å møte nye utfordringer.

backDesc: I always awake earlier. / She awoke from a light sleep. / She has awoken feeling rested.
frontDesc: Jeg våkner alltid tidligere. / Hun våknet fra en lett søvn. / Hun har våknet uthvilt.

backDesc: I usually bear it well. / He bore many difficulties. / He has borne his burdens with courage.
frontDesc: Jeg tåler det vanligvis godt. / Han bar mange vanskeligheter. / Han har båret sine byrder med mot.

backDesc: I beat the drums during the concert. / He beat the record. / He has beaten several records so far.
frontDesc: Jeg slår på trommene under konserten. / Han slo rekorden. / Han har slått flere rekorder så langt.

backDesc: I bend to reach. / She bent the tree branch. / She has bent many branches while gardening.
frontDesc: Jeg bøyer meg for å rekke fram. / Hun bøyde tregrenen. / Hun har bøyd mange greiner mens hun drev med hagearbeid.

backDesc: I bet that you'll arrive on time. / He bet money. / He has bet on many races.
frontDesc: Jeg vedder på at du kommer i tide. / Han veddet penger. / Han har veddet på mange løp.

backDesc: I bid on the artwork. / She bid an offer. / She has bid on several pieces of art.
frontDesc: Jeg byr på kunstverket. / Hun bød et tilbud. / Hun har bydd på flere kunstverk.

backDesc: I bind my shoes before leaving. / He bound the package. / He has bound multiple packages for shipping.
frontDesc: Jeg knyter skoene mine før jeg drar. / Han bandt pakken. / Han har bundet flere pakker for sending.

backDesc: I bite an apple for breakfast. / She bit her finger. / She has bitten her nails many times.
frontDesc: Jeg biter i et eple til frokost. / Hun bet seg i fingeren. / Hun har bitt negler mange ganger.

backDesc: My wound bleeds heavily. / He bled after the fall. / He has bled from similar wounds before.
frontDesc: Såret mitt blør mye. / Han blødde etter fallet. / Han har blødd fra lignende sår før.

backDesc: I blow out the candle on the cake. / He blew up the balloon. / He has blown many balloons for parties.
frontDesc: Jeg blåser ut lyset på kaken. / Han blåste opp ballongen. / Han har blåst opp mange ballonger til fester.

backDesc: I breed dogs at home. / She bred horses on the farm. / She has bred different animals over the years.
frontDesc: Jeg avler hunder hjemme. / Hun avlet hester på gården. / Hun har avlet ulike dyr gjennom årene.

backDesc: I broadcast a radio show. / He broadcast the news live. / He has broadcast important announcements recently.
frontDesc: Jeg kringkaster et radioprogram. / Han kringkastet nyhetene direkte. / Han har kringkastet viktige meldinger nylig.

backDesc: I burn a candle during dinner. / She burnt the papers in the furnace. / She has burnt old letters before.
frontDesc: Jeg brenner et stearinlys under middagen. / Hun brant papirene i ovnen. / Hun har brent gamle brev før.

backDesc: I burst the balloon during play. / He burst into laughter. / He has burst into laughter many times.
frontDesc: Jeg sprenger ballongen under lek. / Han brast i latter. / Han har brast i latter mange ganger.

backDesc: I forgive you for the mistake. / She forgave him for everything. / She has forgiven many people in her life.
frontDesc: Jeg tilgir deg for feilen. / Hun tilga ham for alt. / Hun har tilgitt mange mennesker i sitt liv.

backDesc: I freeze fruits for later. / He froze the water in the fridge. / He has frozen water for ice cubes.
frontDesc: Jeg fryser frukt til senere. / Han frøs vannet i kjøleskapet. / Han har frosset vann for isbiter.

backDesc: I clung to my mother during the storm. / He clung to his beliefs. / He has clung to them all this time.
frontDesc: Jeg klamret meg til moren min under stormen. / Han klamret seg til sine overbevisninger. / Han har klamret seg til dem hele denne tiden.

backDesc: I creep through the grass to avoid being noticed. / She crept quietly. / She has crept in silently before.
frontDesc: Jeg kryper gjennom gresset for å unngå å bli oppdaget. / Hun krøp stille. / Hun har krøpet inn lydløst før.

backDesc: I deal in stocks on the market. / He dealt the goods in the store. / He has dealt in various products before.
frontDesc: Jeg handler med aksjer på markedet. / Han handlet varene i butikken. / Han har handlet med ulike produkter før.

backDesc: I dig a trench in the garden. / She dug to the well. / She has dug many holes for planting.
frontDesc: Jeg graver en grøft i hagen. / Hun gravde til brønnen. / Hun har gravd mange hull for planting.

backDesc: I alighted on a bench in the park. / He alit on the hill. / He has alighted there a few times.
frontDesc: Jeg satte meg på en benk i parken. / Han gikk av på høyden. / Han har gått av der noen ganger.

backDesc: Misfortune befell that family. / He befell bad luck. / Bad luck has befallen him recently.
frontDesc: Ulykke rammet den familien. / Han ble rammet av uflaks. / Uflaks har rammet ham nylig.

backDesc: Every person can beget offspring. / He begot an heir. / He has begotten two children.
frontDesc: Hver person kan avle avkom. / Han avlet en arving. / Han har avlet to barn.

backDesc: I behold the sunset. / She beheld a beautiful landscape. / She has beheld many breathtaking views.
frontDesc: Jeg betrakter solnedgangen. / Hun betraktet et vakkert landskap. / Hun har betraktet mange fantastiske utsikter.

backDesc: I beseech you for help. / He besought forgiveness. / He has besought kindness on many occasions.
frontDesc: Jeg ber deg innstendig om hjelp. / Han ba innstendig om tilgivelse. / Han har bønnfalt om vennlighet mange ganger.

backDesc: He was beset by financial problems. / He beset his targets. / He has beset them with challenges.
frontDesc: Han ble plaget av økonomiske problemer. / Han beleiret målene sine. / Han har plaget dem med utfordringer.

backDesc: Parents chided the child for disobedience. / He chided him publicly. / He has chidden him for his behavior.
frontDesc: Foreldrene irettesatte barnet for ulydighet. / Han irettesatte ham offentlig. / Han har irettesatt ham for oppførselen.

backDesc: I clothe myself for winter. / She clad herself elegantly. / She has clad herself in fine clothes before.
frontDesc: Jeg kler meg for vinteren. / Hun kledde seg elegant. / Hun har kledd seg i fine klær før.

backDesc: I dream of vacations. / He dreamt of a trip. / He has dreamt about traveling the world.
frontDesc: Jeg drømmer om ferier. / Han drømte om en reise. / Han har drømt om å reise verden rundt.

backDesc: I feed the dog every day. / She fed the birds in the garden. / She has fed them every morning.
frontDesc: Jeg mater hunden hver dag. / Hun matet fuglene i hagen. / Hun har matet dem hver morgen.

backDesc: This shirt fits me perfectly. / He fit into the team. / He has fit in well since day one.
frontDesc: Denne skjorten passer meg perfekt. / Han passet inn i teamet. / Han har passet godt inn fra dag én.

backDesc: I flee from the rain. / She fled from home. / She has fled difficult situations before.
frontDesc: Jeg flykter fra regnet. / Hun flyktet hjemmefra. / Hun har flyktet fra vanskelige situasjoner før.

backDesc: I fling a stone into the water. / He flung the bottle out the window. / He has flung objects in anger before.
frontDesc: Jeg kaster en stein i vannet. / Han kastet flasken ut av vinduet. / Han har kastet gjenstander i sinne før.

backDesc: I forbid smoking in the building. / She forbade the children from watching TV. / She has forbidden them multiple times.
frontDesc: Jeg forbyr røyking i bygningen. / Hun forbød barna å se på TV. / Hun har forbudt dem flere ganger.

backDesc: I forecast rain for tomorrow. / He forecast a price increase. / He has forecast such changes accurately.
frontDesc: Jeg varsler regn for i morgen. / Han varslet en prisøkning. / Han har varslet slike endringer nøyaktig.

backDesc: I forsake old habits. / She forsook her dreams. / She has forsaken them all.
frontDesc: Jeg forlater gamle vaner. / Hun forlot drømmene sine. / Hun har forlatt dem alle.

backDesc: I kneel before the altar. / He knelt in a gesture of respect. / He has knelt there many times.
frontDesc: Jeg kneler foran alteret. / Han knelte i en gest av respekt. / Han har knelt der mange ganger.

backDesc: I knit a sweater for winter. / She knitted a scarf. / She has knitted many scarves before.
frontDesc: Jeg strikker en genser til vinteren. / Hun strikket et skjerf. / Hun har strikket mange skjerf før.

backDesc: I lay the book on the table. / She laid the keys on the shelf. / She has laid them there many times.
frontDesc: Jeg legger boken på bordet. / Hun la nøklene på hyllen. / Hun har lagt dem der mange ganger.

backDesc: I lead the team. / He led the company for many years. / He has led numerous successful projects.
frontDesc: Jeg leder teamet. / Han ledet selskapet i mange år. / Han har ledet en rekke vellykkede prosjekter.

backDesc: I lean over the book. / He leant over the table. / He has leaned over it for hours.
frontDesc: Jeg lener meg over boken. / Han lente seg over bordet. / Han har lent seg over det i timevis.

backDesc: I leap on the rope. / He leapt over the fence. / He has leapt across many obstacles.
frontDesc: Jeg hopper på tauet. / Han hoppet over gjerdet. / Han har hoppet over mange hindringer.

backDesc: I light the room's light. / He lit the light in the evening. / He has lit it every night since then.
frontDesc: Jeg tenner lyset i rommet. / Han tente lyset om kvelden. / Han har tent det hver kveld siden da.

backDesc: I mistake in the calculations. / He mistook the decision. / He has mistaken people's intentions before.
frontDesc: Jeg tar feil i beregningene. / Han tok feil i avgjørelsen. / Han har tatt feil av folks hensikter før.

backDesc: I mow the grass in the garden. / He mowed the lawn yesterday. / He has mown it regularly.
frontDesc: Jeg klipper gresset i hagen. / Han klippet plenen i går. / Han har klippet den jevnlig.

backDesc: I overcome difficulties every day. / He overcame his fears. / He has overcome many obstacles.
frontDesc: Jeg overvinner vanskeligheter hver dag. / Han overvant frykten sin. / Han har overvunnet mange hindringer.

backDesc: I partake in meetings. / He partook in the conference. / He has partaken in several events recently.
frontDesc: Jeg deltar i møter. / Han deltok på konferansen. / Han har deltatt på flere arrangementer nylig.

backDesc: I plead for help. / He pled for forgiveness. / He has pled for mercy many times.
frontDesc: Jeg ber om hjelp. / Han ba om tilgivelse. / Han har bedt om nåde mange ganger.

backDesc: I prove my innocence. / He proved his theory. / He has proven it beyond doubt.
frontDesc: Jeg beviser min uskyld. / Han beviste teorien sin. / Han har bevist det uten tvil.

backDesc: I saw wood in the workshop. / He sawed planks for a new boat. / He has sawn many pieces of wood.
frontDesc: Jeg sager ved i verkstedet. / Han saget planker til en ny båt. / Han har saget mange trebiter.

backDesc: I seek the keys at home. / He sought a solution to the problem. / He has sought answers everywhere.
frontDesc: Jeg søker etter nøklene hjemme. / Han søkte en løsning på problemet. / Han har søkt svar overalt.

backDesc: I sew clothes in my atelier. / He sewed a shirt for several hours. / He has sewn many garments.
frontDesc: Jeg syr klær i atelieret mitt. / Han sydde en skjorte i flere timer. / Han har sydd mange plagg.

backDesc: I shear sheep on the farm. / He sheared a sheep yesterday. / He has shorn many sheep this season.
frontDesc: Jeg klipper sauer på gården. / Han klippet en sau i går. / Han har klippet mange sauer denne sesongen.

backDesc: My sweater shrinks after washing. / It shrank in high temperature. / It has shrunk too much.
frontDesc: Genseren min krymper etter vask. / Den krympet ved høy temperatur. / Den har krympet for mye.

backDesc: I slay rodents in the basement. / He slew the monster in the forest. / He has slain many creatures in his stories.
frontDesc: Jeg dreper gnagere i kjelleren. / Han drepte monsteret i skogen. / Han har drept mange skapninger i historiene sine.

backDesc: The kitchen stinks of rotten food. / It stank after a hot day. / It has stunk for hours.
frontDesc: Kjøkkenet stinker av råtten mat. / Det stank etter en varm dag. / Det har stinket i timevis.

backDesc: I stride with confidence. / He strode quickly, arriving on time. / He has stridden through many challenges.
frontDesc: Jeg skrider frem med selvtillit. / Han skred raskt frem og kom i tide. / Han har skredet gjennom mange utfordringer.

backDesc: I strike the ball towards the goal. / He struck the door hard. / He has struck fear into his opponents.
frontDesc: Jeg slår ballen mot målet. / Han slo døren hardt. / Han har slått frykt inn i motstanderne sine.

backDesc: I string beads on a string. / He strung the lamp on the wall. / He has strung decorations before.
frontDesc: Jeg trer perler på en snor. / Han hengte opp lampen på veggen. / Han har hengt opp dekorasjoner før.

backDesc: I strive to achieve the goal. / He strove for success for years. / He has striven to reach the top.
frontDesc: Jeg streber etter å nå målet. / Han strevde etter suksess i årevis. / Han har strevd for å nå toppen.

backDesc: I swing on the swing. / He swung on the balcony. / He has swung on that rope many times.
frontDesc: Jeg husker på husken. / Han husket på balkongen. / Han har husket på det tauet mange ganger.

backDesc: I tear the paper to shred it. / He tore the canvas with a knife. / He has torn many papers accidentally.
frontDesc: Jeg river papiret i stykker. / Han rev lerretet med en kniv. / Han har revet mange papirer ved et uhell.

backDesc: I thrust the door to open it. / He thrust the door hard. / He has thrust it open before.
frontDesc: Jeg skyver døren for å åpne den. / Han skjøv døren hardt. / Han har skjøvet den opp før.

backDesc: I tread carefully on the wet floor. / He trod with a confident stride. / He has trodden this path before.
frontDesc: Jeg trår forsiktig på det våte gulvet. / Han trådte selvsikkert. / Han har trådt denne stien før.

backDesc: I undo the move I made. / He undid the changes in the document. / He has undone them completely.
frontDesc: Jeg omgjør bevegelsen jeg gjorde. / Han omgjorde endringene i dokumentet. / Han har omgjort dem fullstendig.

backDesc: I weave a scarf on the knitting needles. / He wove a rug in his workshop. / He has woven several rugs now.
frontDesc: Jeg vever et skjerf på strikkepinnene. / Han vevde et teppe i verkstedet sitt. / Han har vevd flere tepper nå.

backDesc: I weep in sorrow. / He wept after the breakup. / He has wept many tears.
frontDesc: Jeg gråter i sorg. / Han gråt etter bruddet. / Han har grått mange tårer.

backDesc: I wind the watch every morning. / He wound the strings into a tape. / He has wound them neatly.
frontDesc: Jeg trekker opp klokken hver morgen. / Han surret strengene til et bånd. / Han har surret dem pent.

backDesc: I withdraw from the discussion. / He withdrew from the project. / He has withdrawn completely.
frontDesc: Jeg trekker meg fra diskusjonen. / Han trakk seg fra prosjektet. / Han har trukket seg helt tilbake.

backDesc: I withstand difficult conditions. / He withstood the strong wind. / He has withstood many storms.
frontDesc: Jeg tåler vanskelige forhold. / Han tålte den sterke vinden. / Han har tålt mange stormer.

backDesc: I wring out wet towels. / He wrung juice out of fruits. / He has wrung out many towels.
frontDesc: Jeg vrir opp våte håndklær. / Han vred saft ut av frukt. / Han har vridd opp mange håndklær.

backDesc: I freeze food in the freezer. / He froze water for the freezer. / He has frozen enough water for ice.
frontDesc: Jeg fryser mat i fryseren. / Han frøs vann til fryseren. / Han har frosset nok vann til is.

backDesc: I hang a picture on the wall. / He hung the lamp in the room. / He has hung many pictures around the house.
frontDesc: Jeg henger et bilde på veggen. / Han hengte lampen i rommet. / Han har hengt opp mange bilder rundt i huset.
